  freestar.config = freestar.config || {};

        <div class="grid-container" id="main-content">
                            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-x">
    <div class="small-12 medium-12 large-9 cell">

        <div class="grid-x bg-white grid-padding-x grid-padding-y" style="width: 100%; position: relative;" itemtype="http://schema.org/Product" itemscope><div class="cell small-12" id="toptop"><h1 <div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_1" v-pre>
</div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-6"><likes-rating :perfume_id="27039" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></likes-rating></div><div class="cell small-6"><seasons-rating :perfume_id="27039" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></seasons-rating></div><div class="small-12 medium-6 text-center" style="max-height: 50px"><div itemprop="aggregateRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/AggregateRating" itemscope><p class="info-note">Perfume rating&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingValue">4.27</span>&nbsp;out of&nbsp;<span itemprop="bestRating">5</span> with&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingCount" content="841">841</span> votes<meta itemprop="reviewCount" content="102"/></p></div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-12" itemprop="description" v-pre><p><b>Lothair</b> by <b>Penhaligon's</b> is a Aromatic Spicy fragrance for women and men. <b>Lothair</b> was launched in 2014. The nose behind this fragrance is Bertrand Duchaufour. Top notes are Juniper, Cardamom, Fig Leaf, Bergamot, Grapefruit and Red Berries; middle notes are Fig Tree, Lavender, Black Tea, Geranium and Magnolia; base notes are Vanilla, Woody Notes, Cedar, Ambergris, Musk and Oakmoss. </p><p class="reviewstrigger" style="font-size: smaller; color: #83a6c4">Read about this perfume in other languages: <a                     </div>
                    May not be suitable for evening or formal events
                </div>
                    </div>
    </div>
</div>
</pros-cons><div class="cell small-12"><p class="info-note" style="font-size: smaller"><b>Note:</b> The pros and cons listed on this page have been generated using the artificial intelligence system, which analyzes product reviews submitted by our members.         </div>
            <div class="carousel-cell">
            <a href="">
                <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/s.62859.jpg" alt="Meander Amouage">
                <span class="brand">Amouage</span>
                <br>Meander
            </a>

community and you will be able to add your own reviews.</span></p></div></div></div><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_5 -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_5" v-pre>
</div></div><div class="cell small-12"><ul class="tabs" data-deep-link="true" data-update-history="true" data-deep-link-smudge="true" data-deep-link-smudge-delay="500" data-tabs id="deeplinked-tabs"><li class="tabs-title is-active"><a href="#all-reviews" aria-selected="true"><svg class="menu" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 20 20" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M10 18a8 8 0 100-16 8 8 0 000 16zm1-12a1 1 0 10-2 0v4a1 1 0 00.293.707l2.828 2.829a1 1 0 101.415-1.415L11 9.586V6z"clip-rule="evenodd"></path></svg>All reviews by date</a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#popular-positive-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><like style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;"></like><span class="show-for-medium">Positive Reviews</span></a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#popular-negative-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><dislike style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;"></dislike><span class="show-for-medium">Negative Reviews</span></a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#search-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><i class="fas fa-search"></i><span class="show-for-medium">Search</span></a></li></ul><reviews-wrapper><div class="tabs-content" data-tabs-content="deeplinked-tabs"><div class="tabs-panel is-active" id="all-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>All Reviews By Date</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
        <div class="cell destinationreview"></div>                    <div id="parent2359897" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2359897" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Liamrios09"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2308482"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Liamrios09" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2359897ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2359897" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2308482">Liamrios09</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-24">11/24/24 11:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a sampler of this about 5–6 months ago, i thought the opening was great, but oh my lord the dry down was horrendous. I could not stand the dry down and it gave me a terrible headache. Fast forward to today I am looking through my sampler box and decide to give it another try, and wow I love it now. The dry down has this sharp, slightly spicy smell to it, and on top of that you still get that floral note that I believe comes from the Magnolia and all of this just combines so well. Overall I give this a 9.1/10 for smell, and in conclusion I believe this fragrance DEFINITELY needs to macerate.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="2359897"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=2359897#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2336402" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2336402" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hohohoez"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2005863"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2005863.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="hohohoez" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2336402ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2336402" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2005863">hohohoez</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-03">11/03/24 02:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>From looking at the note composition, I had high hopes for this one. It has a lot of my favorite notes -- juniper, fig, floral, woody vanilla. After trying it in person I was left somewhat... disappointed? Like it's not bad, it just fell short of my expectations. Don't get me wrong, it's a well-blended fragrance -- very enjoyable, from opening to dry down. But it's not something I haven't smelled before. There's no uniqueness to it. I've tried a few from Penhaligon's and the dry down for most of their men's selection is pretty similar.<br />
<br />
Anyway, perhaps I should try this again, maybe in a different setting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="2336402"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=2336402#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2331341" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2331341" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JusttheFactsMan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1733487"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1733487.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JusttheFactsMan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ralph-Lauren/Polo-Oud-84012.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84012.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Polo Oud"title="Polo Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2331341ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2331341" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1733487">JusttheFactsMan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-29">10/29/24 07:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>#947 in my "Tour de Fragrance"<br />
<br />
I really like this fragrance. Nice combination of notes. Good performance. If you like Amouage "Sunshine Man" you'll like this. Others in this vein are Malin + Goetz "Moroccan Fig", Hugh Parsons "Hyde Park", Diptyque "Philosykos", Maison Crivelli "Santal Volcanique." I probably prefer Mancera's "Saharian Wind" among the mid-price range perfumers, and the real bargain is Killer Oud "Sunrise" at $25, a Sunshine Man clone. I don't think this would add anything to my collection I don't already have, but if I were starting from scratch and was looking for a single, versatile, attractive scent, this would be a good candidate. Car pool, elevator and close office safe, appropriate date wear. Makes it to lunch. Cooler weather I think. Masculine leaning unisex.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="2331341"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=2331341#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2243839" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2243839" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JusticeEleven"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2217116"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2217116.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JusticeEleven" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Duelle-Eau-de-Toilette-9241.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9241.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Duelle Eau de Toilette"title="Eau Duelle Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2243839ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2243839" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2217116">JusticeEleven</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-09">08/09/24 08:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Just beautiful, subtle, fantastic, and calming. Transports me to a cozy sylvan cabin decked with the most atmospheric lighting and my favorite books. It can help for immersing in fairy land sentiments, subtly so</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="2243839"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=2243839#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2217500" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2217500" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Alibaba40"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1832969"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Alibaba40" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sospiro-Perfumes/Basso-75927.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.75927.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Basso"title="Basso"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2217500ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2217500" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1832969">Alibaba40</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-13">07/13/24 10:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I blind bought this based on the notes and reviews and am extremely happy with my purchase.  I'm a huge fig lover and while the fig is very tamed in this one, the green and aromatics come through and reminds me of a good gin and tonic when you first lift the glass to take your initial sip.  There is a fresh effervescence that lasts with this fragrance.  It’s a gorgeous scent and I’m already contemplating another purchase because I reach for this so often.  Gets genuine compliments and people state it's freshing and unoffending for office and close settings.  It's not strong but could be if oversprayed.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="2217500"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=2217500#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding: 0; border: none; margin: 0;"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6 -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6" v-pre>
</div></div><div id="parent2215344" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2215344" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ronanthelibrarian"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1573798"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1573798.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ronanthelibrarian" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2215344ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2215344" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1573798">Ronanthelibrarian</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-11">07/11/24 10:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Underrated gem. It doesn’t have a heavy or bombastic profile, but there’s just something about it that makes me want to wear it over and over.<br />
<br />
 A milky-yet-airy, fig-infused chai. Smells classy yet youthful, high-quality, and is highly likeable. Performance tends to be an issue with the house, and considering that alongside the notes, I thought it would be a brief-relief type frag that would last an hour max. But it sticks around all day! 4 sprays and I get a pleasant scent cloud that lasts past a full workday.<br />
<br />
I think over spraying could end up being too much of a good thing, but this is a great balance of cardamom, fig leaf, tea and vanilla. A unique and mass appealing scent for a gentleman in a fantasy citadel.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="2215344"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=2215344#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2167383" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2167383" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lostnose2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1933834"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1933834.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lostnose2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2167383ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2167383" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1933834">lostnose2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-25">05/25/24 07:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Great opening.  Sophisticated fragrance as you would expect from a Penhaligon's aristocrat. Overall it is quite nice. Tame, but nice. As mentioned before it fits the profile of the house. Not loud and obnoxious. But high society bliss. But with the name,  Lothair, one would hope it embodied a warrior stance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="2167383"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=2167383#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2133609" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2133609" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nobookclub"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1893126"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1893126.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nobookclub" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/The-Matcha-26-69731.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69731.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Matcha 26"title="The Matcha 26"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2133609ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2133609" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1893126">nobookclub</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-23">04/23/24 06:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The opening is the best part - a striking bitter green citrus. As it dries down, something doesn't work for me. I briefly get black tea and then milk, vanilla, fig and lavender. The fig remains, but so does the juniper and it feels out of balance. Really wanted to like it, but it's not for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="2133609"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=2133609#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2127711" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2127711" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Turtle2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1962244"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1962244.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Turtle2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Halfeti-Leather-61523.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.61523.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Halfeti Leather"title="Halfeti Leather"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2127711ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2127711" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1962244">Turtle2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-17">04/17/24 14:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>100mL bottle.<br />
<br />
As most people can tell you, yes there's fig, juniper, and tea to the point that it reminds many of chai and greenness making it great for spring/fall, and summer to an extent. Definitely office friendly. The vanilla smell lingers more on my skin than the 1.5mL sample I burnt through but it does seem to get more woody with maceration.<br />
<br />
However Lothair has a secret trait that I've discovered, its has enormous potential as a layering scent when combined with other frags. Lothair is both heavy enough to serve as a bottom layer frag, but light enough that you could layer it on top of other, heavier scents more suited for fall/winter. As one other user has described previously, layering Lothair with Halfeti produces a magical effect, but after tinkering with both Halfeti Cedar, and Tragedy of Lord George, I find that Lothair is versatile enough so long as it shares at least one or more notes with whatever else you're layering it with.<br />
<br />
More layering experimentation is necessary but I plan to update my results as it happens.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="2127711"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=2127711#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2127580" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2127580" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Hgf2008"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2032817"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Hgf2008" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2127580ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2127580" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2032817">Hgf2008</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-17">04/17/24 12:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>VERY masculine opening - quite bitter and herbal. But then it relaxes a little into a charming, warm vanilla chai...<br />
<br />
Performance is quite good, but it doesn't project very far (fine for office use I suspect). A really stunning, unusual and well balanced fragrance and one that speaks to Penhaligon's quality.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="2127580"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=2127580#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2117984" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2117984" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tacoscent"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1674105"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1674105.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tacoscent" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Essential-Parfums/Fig-Infusion-73092.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.73092.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fig Infusion"title="Fig Infusion"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2117984ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2117984" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1674105">Tacoscent</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-08">04/08/24 05:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For me this is Penhaligons crown jewel. A perfect combination of spices, vanilla, fig, tea and woods. It has alot going on but nothing sticks out, It’s blended incredibly well with everything working in perfect unison. It has similarities with eau de baux from L’Occitane but where that feels warmer and more holiday season leaning this is brighter and more complex. <br />
<br />
I know Penhaligons gets a lot of flack for performance however I feel this is quite good, it’s not massive but that’s part of its class, the longevity it good, it’s sticks around for a long time once it moves to a skin scent. <br />
<br />
All seasons, all occasions, you will just smell great.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="2117984"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=2117984#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2041904" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2041904" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="velvety_sage"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1792289"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1792289.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="velvety_sage" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Trudon/II-46323.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46323.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="II"title="II"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2041904ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2041904" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1792289">velvety_sage</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-25">01/25/24 14:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I’ve been putting off a review of this perfume, which is one of my favorites, because I just don’t know how to describe it. It’s not one of those fragrances with distinctly identifiable notes, in my opinion. I don’t doubt there are some who would disagree, though… You’re always going to trigger a few people with an honest opinion. <br />
<br />
To me, it’s a little bit fresh, a little sweet, a little powdery, a little creamy, not in the least bit floral, and one of the most addicting scents I’ve ever discovered. When I’m not wearing it, I’ll always pick up the bottle and have a sniff if I pass by. When I do wear it, not only do I notice it on myself all day, but I also receive compliments, though nobody else seems to know quite what it smells like. I guess that’s part of its magic! So, I’m going to go out on a limb here and say that if Penhaligon’s kept the notes a mystery, folks would have a difficult time deciphering Lothair’s message. Longevity is incredible, too, unlike many of their other offerings. <br />
<br />
I realize that this may not be the most helpful review, but I love this perfume so much and felt obligated to leave some kind of praise. My only regret is that I bought it right before the price drop! Hmph!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="2041904"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=2041904#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2034108" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2034108" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="DapperDon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1614689"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="DapperDon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5674.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Endymion"title="Endymion"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2034108ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2034108" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1614689">DapperDon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-17">01/17/24 18:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is odd/ slightly unfamiliar territory with the fig notes for me.<br />
Opening I get a somewhat sparkly juniper &amp; red berries for sure, followed closely by cardamom &amp; tea. It’s spicy, herbal from the fig tree w/ hazy fruity undertones. Unisex.<br />
The opening &amp; mid share a nice pleasant powdery vanilla musk. The spice tones down &amp; warm musk rounds out the notes. This is also the point where I realize this fragrance beginning to resemble qualities of Endymion Cologne 🤤.. EC being more clean/ powdery dapper &amp; Lothair being more oriental musk (like Allure Homme Sport) with the vanilla/ fig tea dry down. EC &amp; Lothair both have this very lite chocolate type aroma I keep picking up. The resemblance goes away in the dry down.<br />
Smells like Burberry Brit w/ added fig leaf + Endymion Cologne.<br />
Woods appears &amp; lingers with the fig tree for the final deep dry down.<br />
Edit: <br />
I really want to like this more, but something about the red berries &amp; fig tree (very noticeable notes) just doesn’t sit well in the composition for a couple hrs. it’s the greenery.. I smell the entire tree- leaf, stem &amp; branch.<br />
Unique yes, but odd! Pleasant, but odd!<br />
Gets a strong Ok for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="2034108"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=2034108#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2004838" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2004838" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MSKMAN"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1301540"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1301540.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MSKMAN" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Le-Beau-55785.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55785.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Le Beau"title="Le Beau"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2004838ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2004838" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1301540">MSKMAN</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-18">12/18/23 20:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lothair is a gem.   It can be worn all year round but does great in the warmer months.   The scent opens with luxurious sweetness, and the juniper and tea accord balance this fragrance. The fragrance has a few subtle nuances, and the application of fig is gorgeously used throughout this scent.  The base is woodsy, creamy, and slightly powdery.  Performance is detectable at the 8-hour mark, which is good during warm weather.   Overall, it is a well-thought-out fragrance that I find enjoyable to wear.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="2004838"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=2004838#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1976861" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1976861" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ellisosb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1058725"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ellisosb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rogue-Perfumery/Fougere-L-Aube-53815.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53815.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fougere L’Aube"title="Fougere L’Aube"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1976861ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1976861" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1058725">ellisosb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-14">11/14/23 18:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is one of the best uses of vanilla I own, and that's including Nishane's Ani. The difference here is that the vanilla is a background player. It's not cloying, creamy, or syrupy; it's just a faint sweetness that adds a little depth to the spices, tea, and woods. <br />
<br />
A *surprising* compliment-getter (for the people who are into that), it's one of those scents that I remind myself to wear more often every time I put it on. With as many as I have, that can be difficult, but I'll be putting in some quality time with it this winter.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1976861"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1976861#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1968071" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1968071" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LauraVTerrazas"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1404949"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1404949.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LauraVTerrazas" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rihla-Eau-de-Parfum-66765.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66765.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Rihla Eau de Parfum"title="Eau Rihla Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1968071ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1968071" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1404949">LauraVTerrazas</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-03">11/03/23 17:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>OMG, the opening of this is outstanding! 😍<br />
It eventually dries down to a warm barbershop-y scent. I really wish the fragrance was more like the opening throughout it's entirety. Personally, this leans more towards the men's side of unisex but as a woman, I still enjoy this very much. I can't believe this doesn't get talked about more! "if I can only pick one house for life" it would definitely be Penhaligon's (Le Labo is up there, too).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1968071"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1968071#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1935386" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1935386" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Llamarose"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1449248"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Llamarose" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rosendo-Mateu-Olfactive-Expressions/Rosendo-Mateu-No-5-Floral-Amber-Sensual-Musk-46115.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46115.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rosendo Mateu Nº 5 Floral, Amber, Sensual Musk"title="Rosendo Mateu Nº 5 Floral, Amber, Sensual Musk"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1935386ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1935386" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1449248">Llamarose</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-23">09/23/23 09:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful, balanced, and clean while remaining interesting. On me the opening is quite spicy, with a note of nutmeg emerging after a few minutes. Looking at the notes, I can see how fig leaf and cardamom might combine to suggest nutmeg. The dry-down feels creamy and comforting. Leans slightly to the masculine side of unisex for me.<br />
<br />
I sampled this in a Penhaligons shop, loved it, and ordered a decant (because the bottle is so expensive). Will probably end up buying a bottle the next time I have a reason to reward myself!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1935386"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1935386#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1935324" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1935324" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Naddyfromtheblock"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1669877"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1669877.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Naddyfromtheblock" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1935324ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1935324" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); It’s magical. Projection and longevity are an issue for me with Penhaligon’s perfumes though. It’s unfortunate cos I would love to have their stunning bottles on my dresser.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1935324"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1935324#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1929484" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1929484" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bethnalween"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1395590"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="bethnalween" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Francesca-Bianchi/Under-My-Skin-46650.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46650.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Under My Skin"title="Under My Skin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1929484ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1929484" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1395590">bethnalween</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-16">09/16/23 11:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tested at selfridges and really enjoyed it but nowhere near enough to pick up a bottle at retail, managed to snag a partial for much less and it excels at this price point. As don00 mentions, the retail is a bit much for a non-wow frag.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1929484"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1929484#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1928995" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1928995" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Whateverwhocares"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1757007"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1757007.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Whateverwhocares" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1928995ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1928995" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1757007">Whateverwhocares</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-15">09/15/23 20:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ahhh nice. Here’s a woody vanilla concoction with deep green nuance. Green complexion. <br />
<br />
Quality vanilla note is dominant. Smells and performs like expensive aromatic lotion, applied after a shower where you’d used soap from the same brand. <br />
<br />
Excellent longevity. Not particularly dynamic or changing. Mild to moderate sillage. Sensual and unisex, with a mild masculine lean.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1928995"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1928995#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1878728" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1862791" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ferra_Verto"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1160884"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ferra_Verto" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dolce-Gabbana/The-Only-One-51249.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51249.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Only One"title="The Only One"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1862791ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1862791" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1160884">Ferra_Verto</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-23">06/23/23 08:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fresh, powdery, &amp; clean aromatic; a wonderful blend between a classic barbershop fougere and a traditionally masculine spicy men's fragrance. <br />
Opening is a lightly spicy green breeze which settles into a powdery lavender green tea. Geranium provides a lovely floral undercurrent that maintains the spicy feel from the opening.<br />
Best in warm &amp; hot weather, projects a bit above arms length.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1862791"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1862791#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1844222" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; This is exactly how Thé Noir by Le Labo should smell. That one smells like whiskey and tobacco but this is actual black tea with a hint of lavender and juniper. The perfect summer scent! Also adding to my collection of accords of juniper berries after I was disappointed by Dedcool No 02. This perfume is redeeming in many ways!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1844222"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1844222#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1824927" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1812692" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="torres_jake"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1699255"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1699255.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="torres_jake" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1812692ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1812692" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1699255">torres_jake</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-19">04/19/23 11:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love at first sniff! The opening smells a bit like gin with cardamom. Then, you'll start smelling the tea, but my favorite's the dry down, it smells a bit milky to my nose. It lasts for about 6-8 hours on my skin but stays longer on my clothes, quite decent for an EDT. Definitely one of my faves!<br />
<br />
Edit: The longevity of this is amazing. I wore this 4 days ago (July 17, 2023), and as I was folding my clothes after doing the laundry, I could still get whiffs of it.<br />
<br />
This would be a great addition to one's rotation/collection: 9.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1812692"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1812692#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1801319" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1801319" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pippingreen"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1678988"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1678988.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pippingreen" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1801319ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1801319" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1678988">pippingreen</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-05">04/05/23 12:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bought a tiny 1ml sample of this because I'd wanted to try more juniper and tea fragrances. Sprayed it once and was overwhelmed because it felt super masculine. I found it again some months later and sprayed it again out of curiosity. Once you get past the very masculine cologne-type initial spray, the dry-down is sweet, spicy, and creamy. The juniper is still there and makes it slightly more masculine, but gets outstaged by the cardamom and vanilla on my skin. I think it would give me a headache if I sprayed more than once but I still like this a lot. I normally hate spicy/woody/sweet fragrances and prefer herbal/fresh/floral, so it's a nice change. It's like a more masculine, black tea version of Coffee Break by MM to me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1801319"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1801319#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1799426" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1799426" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jawaher R.
