padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1766847" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bvarney_zip"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1247616"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1247616.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bvarney_zip" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1766847ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1766847" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1247616">bvarney_zip</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-22">02/22/23 17:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells very similar to Lalique Ombré Noire.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1766847"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1766847#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1738252" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1738252" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="buddhattitude"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1001495"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="buddhattitude" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.27039.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lothair"title="Lothair"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1738252ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1738252" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1001495">buddhattitude</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-19">01/19/23 13:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of my all time spicy favourites!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1738252"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1738252#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1714061" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1714061" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="peanutbuttercups"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1280309"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1280309.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="peanutbuttercups" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1714061ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1714061" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1280309">peanutbuttercups</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-21">12/21/22 05:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I received Lothair as a freebie when buying other Penhaligon's products and I'm so glad I did - it's ended up being a firm favourite. <br />
<br />
To me, this smells incredibly fresh and clean. Initially I<br />
I get a rather strong blast of juniper and citrus, which reminds me somewhat of a gin and tonic - bitter but refreshing. As it dries down the scent rounds out and becomes gently soapy. This smells expensive and elegant. On my skin, it is resolutely unisex. <br />
<br />
Love.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1714061"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1714061#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1695415" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1695415" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pusteblumchen"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/734326"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.734326.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pusteblumchen" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Claus-Porto/Agua-Porto-59581.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.59581.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Agua Porto"title="Agua Porto"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1695415ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1695415" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/734326">Pusteblumchen</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-24">11/24/22 15:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lothair is a feel good scent.<br />
It’s slightly sweet freshness heightens the spirits.<br />
The drydown is soft like lying down in a freshly cleaned bed with silk sheets…<br />
It’s a blessing after a shower. It’s the shield protecting you from evil eyes.<br />
I love it. For me it’s a spring scent. It makes me company until the weather is too hot for its elegant wordiness. Then I let it rest until everything is rising up and blossoming again.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1695415"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1695415#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1657566" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1657566" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="derby2169"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1389884"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1389884.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="derby2169" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Histoires-de-Parfums/1899-Hemingway-18846.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18846.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="1899 Hemingway"title="1899 Hemingway"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1657566ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1657566" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1389884">derby2169</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-02">10/02/22 13:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Barbershop lavender vanilla meets the smoky and spicy juniper and cardamom combination from Eau des Baux (actual juniper oil is listed as an ingredient, undoubtedly I smell it also in Lothair).<br />
<br />
The opening is quite beautiful with that bergamot/lavender shimmer mixing with a doughy powdery vanilla musk evoking classical French retro fougeres. <br />
Quickly the juniper becomes dominant, not as rough and aggressive as in Eau des Baux, which has a charred wood chip feel, but still intense and masculine. A floral undercurrent flows through the formulation bringing cleanliness and airiness.<br />
<br />
Classical, clean, warm, bright, and woody with a bit of a 1900s dandy vibe. I can see Oscar Wilde wearing this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1657566"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1657566#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1608161" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1584493"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1584493#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1580408" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1580408" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="haltak"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1345237"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="haltak" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Erbario-Toscano/Fico-d-Elba-39848.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39848.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fico d'Elba"title="Fico d'Elba"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1580408ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1580408" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1345237">haltak</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-08">06/08/22 14:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Great tips of roasted tea, juniper and cardamom. <br />
Very gentle but not outdated nature. <br />
A more sophisticated fragrance for modern men and women. <br />
1725 is mentioned as a similar scent, but rest assured, it's a better formula and won't fall into the fougère tone. (I'm a woman and I love both scents<br />
) <br />
Safe shopping for ladies and gentlemen.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1580408"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1580408#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1518956" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1518956" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="peacheekean"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1424224"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1424224.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="peacheekean" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-des-Ors/Lune-Feline-29716.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.29716.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lune Feline"title="Lune Feline"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1518956ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1518956" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1424224">peacheekean</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-08">03/08/22 07:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Thankfully this gem of a fragrance has NOT been discontinued, per an associate with Penhaligon’s. The bottle is just being redesigned. <br />
<br />
I adore this fragrance. Longevity and sillage are perfect imo (probably would be better if I could stop sniffing my arm).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1518956"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1518956#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1500631" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1500631" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kaylovely"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1329847"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1329847.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kaylovely" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Alexandre-J/Zafeer-Oud-Vanille-22361.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.22361.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Zafeer Oud Vanille"title="Zafeer Oud Vanille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1500631ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1500631" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1329847">Kaylovely</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-09">02/09/22 03:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>That sweet fig vanilla dry down. Black tea with milk and spices in the background. Not Chai because the spice becomes less intense. Sweet aqua vitae Forte? I sprayed it on a tester and let it dry. On skin waiting for the dry down. I'm not sure if I like the first half on myself, maybe a man. Smells like pepper for the first hour or so. Also reminds me of 1899, Vetiver although not listed.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1500631"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1500631#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1473321" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1473321" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="stalal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/958408"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.958408.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="stalal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Vodka-on-the-Rocks-23899.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.23899.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vodka on the Rocks"title="Vodka on the Rocks"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1473321ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1473321" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/958408">stalal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-12-30">12/30/21 14:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a sweet spot for such perfumes. I find these very unusual and intriguing. This is quintessential Bertrand Duchaufour style. Its unfortunate this has been discontinued (I did buy me my last bottle just recently) but I am happy Geza Schoen’s private brand contains couple of perfumes which smell very close to this. This lasts quite some time, longer on clothing and is perfect for summer.<br />
<br />
Edit: Luckily not discontinued, just repackaged.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1473321"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1473321#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1447210" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1447210" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="FeminineGhost"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1415419"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="FeminineGhost" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1447210ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1447210" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1415419">FeminineGhost</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-16">11/16/21 22:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance starts off SPICY. Like in your face, that’s all you can think of spicy. As it fades so does the spice. Here in lies the dilemma. There is a sweet spot where you will smell like a spicy, warm cup of tea then it keeps fading. It settles to a warm, sweet musk that’s close to the skin. While it’s very pleasant I wouldn’t consider the dry down smell super unique. <br />
People have compared this to chai tea and they’re not wrong- however know that by the end of drydown it’s much more watered down. Wanted to and did love it. If they tweaked that spice to last rather than feed this would be an absolute signature scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1447210"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1447210#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1443258" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1443258" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ravenna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1360311"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1360311.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ravenna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1443258ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1443258" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1360311">ravenna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-09">11/09/21 23:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One that's very soft, but very attractive. Completely unisex. You definitely get the subtle spice, but it always slips under the radar when I wanna reach for something woody because of the poor sillage. I'm excited to layer this with EVERYthing though, because overspraying this scent alone ruins the allure.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1443258"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1443258#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1425204" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1425204" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gurugaraklee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1345901"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1345901.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gurugaraklee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1425204ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1425204" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1345901">gurugaraklee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-09">10/09/21 10:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Overall this is quite a light yet seemingly complex scent. I only really smell the juniper and cardamom on the top with the fig dominating the mid also. Despite this, there does feel to be something else lingering in the scent (in a good way) that I can't quite put my finger on. It could perhaps be the tea adding to the light feel of the scent? I'm not sure. <br />
It becomes quite creamy from the latter stages of the mid and into the base, something which seems to have a place in a few of Penhaligon's fragrances.<br />
<br />
Another common theme among a few of them is that they tend not to project much. Admittedly, this does seem to project more than others but it still is an intimate scent. This is another classy, sophisticated frag from the house.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1425204"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1425204#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1417427" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1417427" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="DrNDJas"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1063104"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1063104.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="DrNDJas" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Caron/L-Anarchiste-6380.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6380.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Anarchiste"title="L'Anarchiste"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1417427ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1417427" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1063104">DrNDJas</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-26">09/26/21 12:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This immediately went to the top of my “loves” list. Soft, long lasting, woody, velvety spiced, with a slightly creamy accord underlying all of this. It’s quite a perfect fragrance. Lothair is sophisticated but has the right amount of ease about it so that it’s versatile, both situationally and seasonally. This is easily one of Penhaligon’s finest and worth the higher price tag that it usually goes for. Makes me feel like I’m being served tea in Buckingham Palace by the liveried butler whilst dispatching the Duke of Windsor at billiards. The stableboys are preparing the horses and hounds for a fox hunt in the grounds below. Tally-Ho!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1417427"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1417427#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1407505" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1407505" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BlueMoon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/601683"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="BlueMoon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1407505ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1407505" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/601683">BlueMoon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-09">09/09/21 20:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>CHAI LATTE<br />
<br />
Sumptuous, well blended, slightly (but not overly) sweet, creamy, with a hint of spiced tea.  Can be worn day or evening. Good longevity and appropriate sillage.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1407505"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1407505#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1394638" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1394638" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Thanasis_87k"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1361577"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Thanasis_87k" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Viking-41698.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41698.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Viking"title="Viking"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1394638ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1394638" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1361577">Thanasis_87k</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-18">08/18/21 14:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's a very pleasant eau de toilette, light yet with rich and sweet background. I assume someone should spray a lot over his/her torso in order to make impression in the room, since it is rather intimate. It stays no more than 4hrs. I get the citrucy notes (I cannot smell the levander) and I can distinguish a fig scent as well, which adds on sweetness. I would say a spring day fragrance, although I wouldn't mind wearing this on warm autumn days. A bit masculine leaning.<br />
If you're into citrucy notes and wouldn't mind a sweet indulging fig touch, go for it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1394638"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1394638#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1392015" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1392015" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Karulo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1364708"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1364708.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Karulo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Delina-43871.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43871.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Delina"title="Delina"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1392015ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1392015" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1364708">Karulo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-14">08/14/21 00:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>By far my favourite Penhaligon scent, I just adore it more and more each time I spray it. Doesn't have the greatest longevity but it's pretty good for an eau de toilette. What makes it stand out for me are the tea and lavender notes. Only wish they made it as an eau de parfum too!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1392015"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1392015#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1365291" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1365291" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="penguinrabbit"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349583"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="penguinrabbit" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Clean/Fresh-Laundry-6763.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6763.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fresh Laundry"title="Fresh Laundry"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1365291ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1365291" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349583">penguinrabbit</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-24">06/24/21 12:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Citrusy opening, quickly becomes black tea and juniper then dries down to a creamy scent on my skin. Unusual notes, lasts a long time.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1365291"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1365291#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1351903" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1351903" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="J350"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201660"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="J350" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1351903ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1351903" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201660">J350</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-30">05/30/21 18:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful scent! Interesting and intricate notes that leads to an outstanding projection and longevity! It’s very rich and creamy which you can almost feel on your skin. I don’t know if it’s just me though but I smell a small hint of coconut too which isn’t listed on the notes. This is a very versatile scent that could be worn day or night and for casual or formal occasions! <br />
<br />
My overall rating: 8.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1351903"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1351903#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1332834" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1332834" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SweetBriar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1018716"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1018716.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SweetBriar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Guidance-78656.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78656.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Guidance"title="Guidance"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1332834ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1332834" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1018716">SweetBriar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-26">04/26/21 18:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A bit too masculine for my enjoyment and a bit too boring and mainstream to want to smell this on my husband.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1332834"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1332834#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1329959" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1329959" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jaclyncxh"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1314803"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1314803.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jaclyncxh" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4547.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Artemisia"title="Artemisia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1329959ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1329959" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1314803">jaclyncxh</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-22">04/22/21 02:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It starts out with a herbal brightness of juniper and a touch of citrus, maybe a bit of bergamot and a lot of green. In an hour the tea, milk, vanilla and spices come along, I get the beautiful cardamom and a sense of more spices. It still retains it's freshness the whole way, and that plays so interestingly with the yummy creaminess. It's both adventurous and comforting at the same time. This lasts for a long time till the end of the wear maybe 10 hours in where it becomes a gentle creamy sandalwood vanilla I could definitely cozy up and fall asleep to. <br />
<br />
It's completely transportive. Something about Penhaligon's staff training and fantastic marketing really works for me, I'm sold on the story of ships, adventure and tea. <br />
<br />
If I had any complaints is that it isn't that projecting, it dies down very quickly in a few hours into a skin scent but it stays that way for a long time. It doesn't make a gigantic impression -  so it's really more of a private experience. It does become a bit cloying after wearing it after a long time, given it's great complexity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1329959"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1329959#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1306232" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1306232" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jero"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/72622"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.72622.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jero" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Dior-Addict-Eau-de-Toilette-25159.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25159.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dior Addict Eau de Toilette "title="Dior Addict Eau de Toilette "></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1306232ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1306232" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/72622">jero</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-11">03/11/21 18:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The key to this frag. is fig, tree or leaf, accompanied by lavender, with cardamon, or vanilla, hardly would one seriously associate master Duchaufour's Lothair with woody feel or as a spicies bringer, it's more of a green picture in cream.<br />
<br />
All very obscure, like the mist faraway, a ship losts its course, breaking the misery for bringing you the fume of dreaming fig flavoured tea in an early morning at the same time.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1306232"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1306232#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1300823" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1300823" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sidewalks"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/513966"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.513966.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sidewalks" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Montale/Chocolate-Greedy-2186.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2186.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chocolate Greedy"title="Chocolate Greedy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1300823ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1300823" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/513966">sidewalks</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-01">03/01/21 17:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Delightful and interesting opening with the Juniper, cardamom, and bergamot. Almost lime-like for a second. The drydown reminds me of L'Occitane's Eau de Baux, but a bit airier and lighter. If Eau de Baux is an autumn scent then Lothair fits a spring-like day. I do think it would be redundant to own both. Lothair has a more interesting progression, and Eau de Baux is perfect. Can't lose with either.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1300823"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1300823#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1287874" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1287874" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vitodito"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1303546"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1303546.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vitodito" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1287874ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1287874" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1303546">Vitodito</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-06">02/06/21 00:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Never been a fan of Penhaligon’s, but when the lady sprayed this to me it was a shock... only Aventus gave me that feel. <br />
<br />
W O W !!!! <br />
<br />
This is one of the best classy smells on earth. <br />
<br />
It’s like a clean fresh shower with a gin tonic and sweet cardamom vanilla. Feels like you’re in a beautiful countryside in spring. Lots of things happening in this juice. The fig milk gives it that non cloying sweetness, that herbal nature sweet beauty. <br />
<br />
If u like fresh, clean, green, vegan sweet frags u wanna try this. Bertrand is such a genius!!!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1287874"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1287874#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1277407" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1277407" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="toni.w"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/531361"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="toni.w" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Douze/Sans-Rival-Leo-83929.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.83929.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sans Rival Leo"title="Sans Rival Leo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1277407ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1277407" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/531361">toni.w</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-17">01/17/21 07:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If Juniper Sling, Endymion and Elisabethan Rose 2018 had a love child, it would be named Lothair.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1277407"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1277407#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1274874" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1274874" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jeorge345"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1292758"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1292758.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jeorge345" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Floris/Honey-Oud-25612.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25612.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Honey Oud"title="Honey Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1274874ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1274874" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1292758">jeorge345</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-12">01/12/21 13:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Blind buy, purchased in the 2021 Winter Sale because it was a very favorable price. Lothair by Penhaligon's is truly a work of art, I would even go as far as to call it a masterpiece; a true story in a bottle - It is perfectly blended, fresh, complex, and exciting yet comforting at the same time. Lothair is a fragrance that fits perfectly with Penhaligon's 'classic British stereotype', almost comedic marketing which I initially found jarring - but now I get it.<br />
<br />
Normally outside of my preferences but I absolutely adore this offering by Penhaligon's. Early on, it evokes imagery of an archetypal victorian explorer relaxing at the end of the day in an exotic locale with a gin and tonic and flavored cigar with a plate of fresh fruit beside them. During the dry-down, the more delicate tea notes and lavender begin to shine. As time further passes, the base notes begin to come through revealing a very comforting and delicately sweet 'warm wood' scent - our explorer is winding down for the day; relaxing by a fire, drinking a cup of tea, and reminiscing about their doubtless, exciting day.<br />
<br />
Longevity is impressive and I can still smell it now having applied it almost 9 hours ago.<br />
<br />
I hope this one never goes away, it truly is a masterclass in perfumery. This fragrance is signature scent worthy for sure, people will not forget you if you wear this!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1274874"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1274874#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1235804" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1235804" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ardamiactadh"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1193766"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1193766.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ardamiactadh" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1235804ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1235804" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1193766">Ardamiactadh</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-10-12">10/12/20 07:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The notes as well as some of the reviews sound lovely. <br />
<br />
Reality for me is disappointing. If I was being charitable I’d say well blended but honestly the overall impression is less than the sum of its parts which I don’t find easily identifiable anyway. It does not smell particularly natural to me and there’s a bitterness behind the softer notes that catches my throat like a locker room spray. <br />
<br />
If you like this sort of smell you’d be better off getting Oriflame Eternal Man which can be bought for a tiny fraction of the price and while it doesn’t smell identical is the same sort of thing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1235804"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1235804#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1230691" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1230691" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SmellMyCheese"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1171159"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1171159.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SmellMyCheese" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1230691ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1230691" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1171159">SmellMyCheese</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-09-29">09/29/20 17:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The notes breakdown suggest I should love this it has about everything I enjoy in a fragrance but there is something a little too flat about this one.<br />
<br />
It kind of comes across as a spicy ginger tea, maybe with a touch of fruity sweetness and a drop of cream.<br />
<br />
It’s unique I’d say, and it’s nice but doesn’t excite me like I thought it would.<br />
<br />
I don’t quite agree with the comparison to Parco Palladiano Cipresso that others have put. I see what you mean but Cipresso has a far more natural feel and more personality imho. In terms of longevity, they are quite similar though in that they turn light fairly quickly but last a while in that stage.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1230691"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1230691#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1215257" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1215257" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="katariina9"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/229642"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.229642.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="katariina9" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Comme-des-Garcons/Comme-des-Garcons-Series-7-Sweet-Nomad-Tea-4378.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4378.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Comme des Garcons Series 7 Sweet: Nomad Tea"title="Comme des Garcons Series 7 Sweet: Nomad Tea"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1215257ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1215257" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/229642">katariina9</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-23">08/23/20 16:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lothair is one of my favourites from Penhaligon's offerings, most of which I've sampled. It's the scent for cardamom and tea lovers. Crisp and clean, most of the freshness comes from juniper. The familiar G&amp;T note will tingle your nostrils at the opening, and stays until the dry down whilst giving this Trade Route scent a slightly windy and dynamic character. I'm born on an island covered with junipers so this smells like soothing yet energising seaside. I may as well stand on the rough beach eating a warm cardamom roll with a cup of black tea &amp; milk in the other hand.<br />
<br />
The whole scent experience here is expertly blended between soothing/calming and energising/refreshing. Lavender, juniper, bergamot, tea and green fig are all individually present, yet singing in perfect harmony, providing shelter yet urging you to move on. As the scent develops, cardamom is fully out in the open. There are no flowers or berries in the foreground, but they are invisibly keeping the balance, as is also vanilla that rounds things up when woods enter making the dry down amazingly cosy. Its a wonderful herbal aromatic concoction and a perfect scent for a dynamic duo to share. It never steps a foot more into feminine or masculine territory. Keeping it all on even keel.<br />
<br />
EDIT: I got it in its 100 ml presentation some 24 months ago. Considering I've a decent scent rotation, lots of samples and there has been home-office-anchored no-travel no-event situation for a year, I've managed to almost finish my Lothair. A small miracle.
