Or perhaps not. Its a strong love and will be a repeat purchase.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1215257"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1215257#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1210681" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1210681" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HEATHEN PERFUMES"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1039526"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1039526.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="HEATHEN PERFUMES" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Oud-Minerale-45192.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45192.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oud Minérale"title="Oud Minérale"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1210681ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1210681" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1039526">HEATHEN PERFUMES</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-12">08/12/20 13:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lothair by Penhaligon's is the smell of freshness and vegetation, the smell of forests and meadows. Lothair is natural, but modern, dynamic, lively and intense. There is probably a bit of everything in it that can be associated with nature. It is fresh yet warm, watery yet green, woody yet spicy, airy yet aromatic.<br />
<br />
In the opening, Lothair feels more masculine thanks to intense and fresh notes of juniper and lavender. These notes are accompanied by various other ones: fig and tea leaves and a number of woody notes, including cedar. In addition, the whole mixture is freshend up with citruses: juicy bergamot and delicate grapefruit. Besides before mentioned notes, somewhere in the background there is also a spicy, warm, vanillic and at the same time animalic, delicate mixture consisting of: aromatic cardamom, sweet vanilla, grey ambergris and musk.<br />
<br />
As it develops, Lothair gets warmer, calms down and even becomes cosy. This is the stage when a beautiful cardamom-vanilla base with a whole lot of woody notes, delicate oak moss and also the sensual scent of grey ambergris and musk starts to shine. The whole blend still remains fresh though, as the aromatic, fresh notes of juniper, lavender, delicate green notes and light geranium are still noticeable.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1210681"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1210681#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1176405" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1176405" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="molly1217"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1232898"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1232898.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="molly1217" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Doblis-4659.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4659.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Doblis"title="Doblis"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1176405ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1176405" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1232898">molly1217</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-05-16">05/16/20 03:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Trade Routes collection of the most popular section, with the typical style of Penhaligon.<br />
This name reminds me of the Boston Tea Party of 1773 caused by the tea tax, though the company said there is no correlation, but I have great interest in it.<br />
Speaking Lothiar, belongs to the type of light oriental, in the fresh top notes of lemon, grapefruit, mixed with cardamom, then this common approach combined with lavender and fig, will be able to drown out the thick feeling. Base notes add vanilla, slightly sweet, and smell like English milk tea.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1176405"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1176405#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1129212" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1129212" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TallulahBea"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1210663"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1210663.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TallulahBea" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Juliette-Has-A-Gun/Vengeance-Extreme-13031.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13031.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vengeance Extreme"title="Vengeance Extreme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1129212ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1129212" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1210663">TallulahBea</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-12-30">12/30/19 07:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lothair is my current favourite perfume! Complex, exotic, classy and original. In particular, I like the sweet,creamy,Chai with cardamom that I get from it, and it makes me constantly sniff my wrist and clothes when I wear it. Longevity is good, but I'm not sure about the sillage. Strangely, despite how much I love it, nobody has ever commented when I have worn it, which does happen with some perfumes I like less. It stays however my "special occasion wanting to smell classy" fragrance!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1129212"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1129212#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1075748" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1075748" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Andy the Frenchy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1165781"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1165781.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Andy the Frenchy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1075748ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1075748" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1165781">Andy the Frenchy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-07-04">07/04/19 06:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Aromatic lavender, with citrus freshness on top and - unfortunately for me - a sweet base. I agree with a previous comment: this one shares similarities with Lutens Fourreau Noir. But Lutens does it better imo.<br />
Duchaufour can do better than that, and indeed did better than that! A fragrance designed in the first place to sell well, more than being a work of art.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1075748"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1075748#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1073463" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1073463" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kndy38"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/619912"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="kndy38" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Pacific-Chill-81423.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.81423.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pacific Chill"title="Pacific Chill"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1073463ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1073463" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/619912">kndy38</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-06-26">06/26/19 13:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love at first sniff.<br />
<br />
It starts refreshing with the lavender blast.<br />
<br />
<br />
It does remind me of Gucci pour Homme 2, and also Eau des baux in the drydown. <br />
<br />
I would totally classify this one as a modern classic too.<br />
<br />
<br />
I wish Penhaligon's would make better concentrations! It is almost too polite for this quality juice, you want to be noticed! <br />
<br />
9/10, wondering if I'll buy a full bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1073463"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1073463#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1073300" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1073300" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cocofluff"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1141155"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1141155.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cocofluff" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/Bendelirious-4511.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4511.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bendelirious"title="Bendelirious"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1073300ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1073300" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1141155">cocofluff</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-06-26">06/26/19 02:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Excellent opening! Invigorating and refreshing. I smell juniper, bergamot and the grapefruit. It's fresh and sweet. The opening is herbal. And the drydown is creamy. I don't even mind the oakmoss because I can't detect it. It's perfect for daytime wear. Unisex as well. I really like it but not enough to buy a bottle. -</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1073300"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1073300#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1062966" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1062966" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Narciso70"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/980944"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.980944.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Narciso70" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bortnikoff/Oud-Monarch-54480.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54480.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oud Monarch"title="Oud Monarch"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1062966ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1062966" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/980944">Narciso70</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-05-22">05/22/19 09:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There cannot be a negative review for this perfume, even for the most trained noses. Because every so often you need a break from all the strange smells good and less good. This is a "classic" perfume that always knows something good, for all seasons, for all hours, for all moods. Fantastic.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1062966"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1062966#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1025164" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1025164" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="j&aelig;"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1163986"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1163986.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="j&aelig;" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1025164ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1025164" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1163986">j&aelig;</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-01-27">01/27/19 21:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>How can a fragrance be so light and delicate yet so complex at the same time? Lothair manages to neutralize that contradiction. Unlike most of Penhaligon's other offerings, this one is both dynamic and long-lasting. Milky fig, bright and fresh juniper, smooth, reassuring tea all make for a subtly dazzling olfactory experience. Very unisex and inviting. Like taking a breath of fresh, fragrant air in the countryside after sitting in an air-conditioned rental car for six hours. A real delight.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1025164"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1025164#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1022671" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1022671" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fromthebayandaroundtheway"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1047408"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1047408.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fromthebayandaroundtheway" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1022671ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1022671" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1047408">fromthebayandaroundtheway</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-01-20">01/20/19 14:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lothair is a fragrance that tells a story. In my opinion Monsieur Duchaufour with Lothair tells the tale of what the bounty of these merchant ships of yore may have smelt like. I imagine that Lothair is the end result of several chests containing the bounty of rare spices and aromatic goods being opened and displayed before the royal court.<br />
<br />
Yes, that intro may have seemed a bit too far fetched, but really the initial blast of cardamom, fig leaf and lavender create a real olfactory statement and unveils a real concept; A beautiful collection of rich herbs, florals and spices on full display. All these great notes are framed by woody notes and cedar (think wooden chest and the wooden ships that would bring these bounties to a new home). There is even a well placed slightly salty note of ambergris to give a sea spray over this maritime haul.<br />
<br />
I love this fragrance and cannot recommend it enough. It is unisex and is perfect for spring and early fall. Think fun and good times, basically a walk in the park or a sunny walk on the boulevard. Give Lothair a few sprays under a linen shirt to celebrate the brilliance and joy of spring and all that will bloom during this lovely time of year.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1022671"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1022671#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent994792" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc994792" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="echo4kilo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1153785"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1153785.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="echo4kilo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/FZOTIC/Room-237-30364.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30364.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Room 237"title="Room 237"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma994792ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd994792" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1153785">echo4kilo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-25">10/25/18 19:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligons makes a some really great fragrances. I own Sartorial and Opus 1870. I think Lothair will be my third from the brand. I like how it has a fresh spiciness and sweetness to it but its nice and not overpowering.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="994792"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=994792#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent983940" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc983940" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Maya.ArroyoBurton"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/431858"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.431858.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Maya.ArroyoBurton" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Karl-Lagerfeld/Chloe-Parfums-Lagerfeld-50352.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50352.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chloé (Parfums Lagerfeld)"title="Chloé (Parfums Lagerfeld)"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma983940ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd983940" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/431858">Maya.ArroyoBurton</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-09-21">09/21/18 07:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>As I write this review, I'm sniffing this perfume from the bottle... The first thing I get is lavender and then all the citrus notes.... slightly woody as it drys down... I smell everything at once but it's not overpowering..... I would definitely buy a full bottle of this... So delicious and sexy... Can be worn for any occasion.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="983940"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=983940#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent952975" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc952975" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="F2097"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="F2097" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma952975ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd952975" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212">F2097</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-06-16">06/16/18 06:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've tried a lot of the Penhaligons range. The past few years have been very good to me, I've been able to afford to buy a lot of them and also regularly get them bought for me too. I could choose any brand really, but I enjoy Penhaligons the most. What I'm getting at is that I feel quite qualified when it comes to writing about their scents.<br />
<br />
This one is their best.<br />
<br />
No question about it. This fragrance is a timeless, beautiful blend that suits every occasion and gives you a feeling of confidence and comfort. <br />
<br />
Some of the other ones like English Fern, Hammam and Zizonia I have deep connections to, or Halfeti which I think is their second best. This is the best made, suits the widest range of moods or reasons to wear perfume.<br />
<br />
If this was any other type of product, like a soap or shower gel, it wouldn't work. I think in a sample size or of they did a 50ml like they do for some of their scents, you wouldn't get the full experience either. The amount you get from a spray and how it distributes effects the feel of this.<br />
<br />
The story behind this links to clipper ships and the tea trade. Although it does match up with that description, it also makes me think of the remote Outer Hebridies in Scotland. The calm tranquillity that comes from the isolation, the stillness of the sea, endless beaches. That feeling of remoteness and the comfort when you go inside and feel protected from the weather.  <br />
<br />
The whole time you are there you feel a distance between reality, a history, a connection with the past and how hard life must have been there. I don't know how but Lohair gives me the same feeling and impression.<br />
<br />
It's milky and comforting, there is an undertone of sophistication and quality. You also get a sour sharpness that increases the complexity. It all swirls round.<br />
<br />
Where Penhaligons have so many fragrances and so many of those have come out around the same time; lots of them share elements. Quite a few take wholesale parts of each other. <br />
<br />
Lothair is pretty unique in the range, the only one that I think bears much resemblance is Espirit Du Roi. They share a similar top notes, the part of the scent that seems elevated but to the back of it. The rest of the composition is so different and Lothair is so much more complex and delicately tuned. It stands out in the range as the finest of all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="952975"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=952975#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent952129" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc952129" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Badjohana"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1133908"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Badjohana" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma952129ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd952129" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1133908">Badjohana</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-06-13">06/13/18 12:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am fast becoming a fan of Penhaligon's.  I find their scent interesting. Many are complex and intriguing with real depth never boring. <br />
 I really would not recommend blind buying Penhaligon's because there are some rather bold offerings there (Halfeti <br />
for example is very good but one i will admire from afar, it is utterly not for me).  You need time and patience too because the scents shape-shift over long periods of time.  Lothair is one of the few that I liked immediately and to my surprise because greeny-woodsy would not normally be my cup of tea. The floral notes are present but neither twee nor sticky.    Likewise there is freshness, but the citrus never goes into light cologne mode.  A fine balancing act of invigorating freshness with depth, body and a wee pinch of sugar.  Perfect.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="952129"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=952129#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent952128" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc952128" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Badjohana"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1133908"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Badjohana" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma952128ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd952128" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1133908">Badjohana</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-06-13">06/13/18 12:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am fast becoming a fan of Penhaligon's.  I find their scent interesting. Many are complex and intriguing with real depth never boring. <br />
 I really would not recommend blind buying Penhaligon's because there are some rather bold offerings there (Halfeti <br />
for example is very good but one i will admire from afar, it is utterly not for me).  You need time and patience too because the scents shape-shift over long periods of time.  Lothair is one of the few that I liked immediately and to my surprise because greeny-woodsy would not normally be my cup of tea. The floral notes are present but neither twee nor sticky.    Likewise there is freshness, but the citrus never goes into light cologne mode.  A fine balancing act of invigorating freshness with depth, body and a wee pinch of sugar.  Perfect.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="952128"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=952128#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent862654" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc862654" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cherry_Darling"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1003821"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1003821.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cherry_Darling" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Pascal-Morabito/Perle-Pour-Elle-47506.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47506.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Perle Pour Elle"title="Perle Pour Elle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma862654ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd862654" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); But it blends in nicely with the warm spicies, it's green and warm spicy. Very enjoyable!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="862654"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=862654#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent841502" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc841502" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lovelolitalempicka"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/409039"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.409039.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lovelolitalempicka" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Les-Exclusifs-de-Chanel-28-La-Pausa-7131.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.7131.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Les Exclusifs de Chanel 28 La Pausa"title="Les Exclusifs de Chanel 28 La Pausa"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma841502ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd841502" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/409039">Lovelolitalempicka</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-07-15">07/15/17 03:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fresh, grassy, aromatic with enough else going on to keep a bit of interest. Not a fan of Penhaligon's (though I really want to be), their output has been so mediocre, the only interesting things have been the concepts and the names, the smells all one dimensional, tired, dull, plus I have yet to forgive them for discontinuing Violetta (I understand it's economic reasons and if I am the only one who likes it, it's not worth making blablabla). But this one passes muster. Just about. If I got it for christmas I'd say thank you and mean it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="841502"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=841502#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent834111" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc834111" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="OneBlueSummer"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/899730"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.899730.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="OneBlueSummer" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Andree-Putman/Tan-d-Epices-33889.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.33889.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tan d'Epices"title="Tan d'Epices"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma834111ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd834111" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/899730">OneBlueSummer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-06-20">06/20/17 16:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>ya kinda awkward Royal Oud.. something blanding it out almost creamy minty maybe the jasmine .. na. If they would have taken out that fig leaf and the cardamon this would have been a winner. Save your money buy its rich better brother by Creed. Blind bought and had it up on ebay in 1 day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="834111"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=834111#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent814450" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc814450" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Yushcan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/489924"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.489924.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Yushcan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Roja-Dove/Elysium-Pour-Homme-Parfum-Cologne-46296.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46296.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Elysium Pour Homme Parfum Cologne"title="Elysium Pour Homme Parfum Cologne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma814450ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd814450" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/489924">Yushcan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-04-20">04/20/17 07:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oh, I'm sorry, but it reminds me Fourreau Noir fragrance by Serge Lutens, almost completely!!! as regards to longevity and projection Pengaligon's one is weaker. That's it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="814450"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=814450#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent800506" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc800506" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Edemay"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/918978"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.918978.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Edemay" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Zara/Rose-Gourmand-For-Her-63268.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.63268.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose Gourmand For Her"title="Rose Gourmand For Her"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma800506ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd800506" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/918978">Edemay</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-03-09">03/09/17 15:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very dimensional scent <br />
Its like a mix of duellle with a fresh mens cologne.<br />
Starts off vey warm and sweet, i notice the cardamon and vanilla.<br />
But settles into a really interesting herby/green cologne smell, not in a bad way at all its very different.<br />
I see this as totally masculine and with great performance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="800506"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=800506#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent794272" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc794272" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tigerlillian"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/40335"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.40335.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tigerlillian" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Jasmine-Sambac-Marigold-49714.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49714.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jasmine Sambac & Marigold"title="Jasmine Sambac & Marigold"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma794272ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd794272" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/40335">Tigerlillian</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-02-18">02/18/17 23:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lothair, my first full Penhaligon's bottle. I've sampled plenty and have never felt compelled to purchase until now... and blind at that. Unquestionably no regrets.<br />
<br />
When the Trade Routes collection launched, it was so compelling to me on reading the release and set me off into a spiritual odyssey of spices, resins, textures and color from the East that danced in my olfactory imagination.<br />
<br />
Fast forward a couple of years, and of the ones I had sampled, nothing yet had really moved me. Revisiting the notes and reviews on Lothair, and seeking something a little different to what I have had in my collection in the past, I decided it was time to get my hands on a bottle.<br />
<br />
Lothair... a pure aromatic tonic. And the bottle is so beautiful and stately to look at with its fastidious navy bow. My initial spray delivered a blue-green haze of fresh juniper and bitter, but sparkling citrus peel.<br />
<br />
Typically, fragrances develop very quickly on my skin, but not Lothair. This budded ever so delicately over the course of at least an hour, behaving very much like an eau fraiche.<br />
<br />
Juniper berries and crushed, green fig leaf excreted a light milky sap that was as luminous as salty dew drops high on a merchant ship's mast at dawn. Cedar and cardamom released a subtle, camphorous, tannic vapor. Here I kept falling between fresh, cool air, and a warm, arid tingle -- sunrise on the North Atlantic Ocean.<br />
<br />
Magnolia, lavender and geranium aren't singularly discernable but soften and balance the composition. More than anything the lavender and geranium contribute an herbal, floral nuance while still remaining on the classically masculine side of a unisex scent.<br />
<br />
I couldn't really tease out any vanilla either, if it's there, it's a drop boozy and grounds the aromatics along with a touch of warm ambergris and a ghostly whisper of musk.<br />
<br />
I can see myself wearing Lothair a lot. I love spritzing it my hair and tousling it with my hands, just to get a rush of crisp, briny air billowing in my sails.<br />
<br />
As far as trade routes go, I feel Lothair is an outbound commodity: cardamom imported from the East, infused into a Britannic distillation of botanicals to create a fine artisanal gin with a splash of citric Earl Grey. It draws a marked parallel to one of my favorite spirits -- The Botanist Islay Dry Gin -- reserved only for the captain's quarters.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="794272"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=794272#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent770277" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc770277" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jospie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/501612"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="jospie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Givenchy/Amarige-3.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Amarige"title="Amarige"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma770277ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd770277" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/501612">jospie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-12-13">12/13/16 10:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells wonderful- it is very green and fresh but milky, warm and woody at the same time. Perhaps like eating a fresh bowl of cold salad with ranch dressing in a warm sauna made of wood. haha sounds wierd but it's lovely I promise! <br />
<br />
A broken stalk of fig tree with oozing sap and classic Penhaligon's juniper berry is the most prominant at first. <br />
It quickly becomes comfortingly milky and aromatic as it's being warmed up, with cardamom and rosemary. There is also a smooth saltiness -I'm guessing its the ambergris note. It is quite feminine up to this point, and I find it very wearable as a woman!<br />
But then as it dries down, the ceder and oakmoss comes in and turns very masculine - a tiny bit more so than I am completely comfortable with - but that makes it quite sexy when I am in the right mood ;)<br />
Overall, it is a very sophisticated and unique scent!<br />
<br />
Sillage and longevity all moderate, but I could still smell this on my coat two weeks later :)<br />
<br />
btw, I just realized now that I own 3 Penhaligon's scents and all by Bertrand Duchafour! Amaranthine, Tralala, and Lothair! How incredible is that! And I thought I chose the most atypical, wierdest scents from this house!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="770277"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=770277#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent737182" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc737182" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mohsen95"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/995817"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.995817.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mohsen95" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma737182ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd737182" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/995817">mohsen95</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-08-29">08/29/16 09:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="737182"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=737182#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent711711" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc711711" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gedlive"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/866522"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.866522.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gedlive" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Equipage-7.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.7.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Equipage"title="Equipage"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma711711ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd711711" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/866522">gedlive</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-06-03">06/03/16 14:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It reminded me of a gourmand by Duchaufour, Noir Exquis.<br />
This is a nice sweet smelling fragrance, but there is nothing that makes it stand out as a very good fragrance, it's just fair to Midland. <br />
I was expecting a fresh fig fragrance, but I don't get any fig or fig tree, and I have 4 fig fragrances. So it's not very fresh, and it's not quite gourmand, although it is sweet.<br />
<br />
OK, let me give you an insight as to what this smells like if your considering it.<br />
Lothair is mostly Cardamom and sweet vanela, with a bit of grapefruit freshness. There a bit of pink berry spice and some woodiness. The other notes are hidden nuances.<br />
<br />
So this fragrance seems confused, it's caught in the middle of gourmand and fresh. Noir Exquis is similar but a very good and interesting gourmand by my favorite parfumer Bertrand Duchaufour.<br />
If your looking for a nice fresh fragrance with good fig and fig tree notes, I recommend Acqua di Parma Fico di Amalfi.<br />
<br />
Update: I'm finishing my sample of Lothair thinking that it's better than I first thought. The performance is very good, and it has a nice potent sharpness to it, very Duchaufour esk...<br />
<br />
Rating: 8:10<br />
<br />
God bless.  John 3:16</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="711711"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=711711#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent691338" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc691338" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Weihan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/369178"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Weihan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Spice-and-Wood-10101.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10101.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Spice and Wood"title="Spice and Wood"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma691338ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd691338" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/369178">Weihan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-03-28">03/28/16 23:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Three thumbs up for Penhaligon's on this one! The fragrance itself is very sophisticated, with great silage and phenomenal longevity. On my skin it's almost a dead ringer for Creed's Royal Oud. It's definitely more of a late afternoon / evening fragrance with a hint of mystery. Very nice indeed.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="691338"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=691338#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent683251" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc683251" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ChubbyPillow93"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/616116"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.616116.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ChubbyPillow93" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma683251ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd683251" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/616116">ChubbyPillow93</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-03-03">03/03/16 02:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Indisputable and unparalleled masterpiece of Penhaligon's.<br />
I have never seen a perfume that can combine fig/lavender/vanilla/black tea without any disharmony.A huge thumb-up for Duchaufour!<br />
<br />
Among all the works of Bertrand Duchaufour, this is my favorite.And it has a beautiful name indeed:) Even at the first time I tested it I was sure that it is going to be marvelous.Although the lavender note has won quite a few votes, I would rather focus more on the fig &amp; black tea notes.Lothair belongs to the Trade Routes collection, and it was inspired by the famous Tea Clipper Ships.Therefore I believe that the black tea should be the theme of it.The tea leaves have the special astringent taste and the "unsmooth" but fresh smell, which made it very intriguing——for the fig/fig leaves smell are usually described as creamy and smooth.But!The combination turned out not to be a collision, but a surprisingly perfect harmony.<br />
<br />
The lavender here, despite the dominance, has already lost the soapy and harsh traits, I presume that it was vanilla's credit;Eventually, the whole thing has developed into a mixture of green/spice/creamy aroma, although it has the traditional aromatic structure(lavender/juniper/oakmoss), I myself consider this more as a modern artwork.<br />
<br />
-</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="683251"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=683251#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent666856" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc666856" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pianomelody"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/775391"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.775391.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pianomelody" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Bapteme-du-Feu-39436.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39436.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Baptême du Feu"title="Baptême du Feu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma666856ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd666856" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/775391">Pianomelody</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-01-13">01/13/16 13:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fresh,sparkling and versatile, but also complex! I like Lothair,he gives me joy and it relaxes me. This fragrance is not heavy...opens with cardamom grapefruit red fruits and juniper..it's really nice and lively the beginning. Each note stands out well, in the middle notes become more "spicy" and evolves in a really nice getting hotter, while maintaining its freshness (thanks to lavender and black tea). Overall it is a light fragrance, suitable for spring days, transports you making you feel in perfect union with nature. The sillage is moderate, longevity pretty good. Beautiful.<br />
<br />
Sillage: 6.5/10<br />
Longevity: 7/10<br />
Scent: 8.5/10<br />
<br />
