Overall: 9/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="666856"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=666856#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent664572" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc664572" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="perfumebox"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/270008"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.270008.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="perfumebox" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Feve-Delicieuse-30164.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30164.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fève Délicieuse"title="Fève Délicieuse"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma664572ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd664572" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/270008">perfumebox</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-01-07">01/07/16 00:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you love a good tea scent, try this.<br />
<br />
It's not overtly sexy, but I can imagine this smelling extremely appealing on a man, and equally lovely and unique on a woman. Sometimes "unisex" is more like "sexless". This is not that.<br />
<br />
The lavender and juniper blast is quite masculine and dry at first but once it warms up and dries down, the gorgeous black tea, magnolia and fig milk comes out, rounds it out and adds warmth and "roundness" without falling into an obviously feminine territory.<br />
<br />
What's lovely is that the inviting amber and musk and vanillin is very soft and doesn't take away from the translucent, luminous quality of the whole thing. It is quiet but has presence, and lasts very well for an EDT.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="664572"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=664572#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent649485" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc649485" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Allegralovescent"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/971046"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.971046.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Allegralovescent" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma649485ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd649485" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/971046">Allegralovescent</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-11-19">11/19/15 15:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Gorgeous unique scent. As a woman I find this very wearable.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="649485"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=649485#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent643756" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc643756" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LeonieB"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/891081"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="LeonieB" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-Cologne/Iris-Rebelle-48137.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48137.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Iris Rebelle"title="Iris Rebelle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma643756ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd643756" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/891081">LeonieB</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-10-31">10/31/15 05:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very wearable fruity fresh unisex scent, lifted initially with tea, softened in the middle with fig and vanilla, and warmed up ultimately with soft spicy wood. Beautifully blended and balanced, doesn't put a foot wrong (should think not at that price).<br />
As such, would probably bore the pants off the niche scent lover who likes a surprise, be it nice or nasty.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="643756"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=643756#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent639694" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc639694" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ivyheel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/43035"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.43035.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ivyheel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-Cologne/Bergamote-Soleil-35155.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.35155.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bergamote Soleil"title="Bergamote Soleil"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma639694ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd639694" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/43035">ivyheel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-10-17">10/17/15 08:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligon's has quickly risen up the ranks as one of my favorite perfume houses, with Lothair being my most recent favorite. The advertisement for this fragrance promised to somehow take me back to the age of English tea clipper ships that delivered precious goods from around the world. To my delight, I seem to have stumbled upon a case of truth in advertisement.  The overall sentiment I get when wearing Lothair is that of being in a dry cargo hold surrounded by a mountain of crates containing tea, lavender, vanilla bean, dried fruits, and a mixture of other delightful commodities.<br />
<br />
On spraying, I get an incredibly strong black tea note (not brewed, but dried loose tea leaves), softened by a good dose of lavender and vanilla. Within minutes, the black tea is tamed and the vanilla gains steam along with a note that I am fairly sure is juniper. Fig is there (creamy!) but my nose seems to confuse it with some other scents...Overall it's herbaceous, creamy, and weird in a very good way.<br />
<br />
This is a powerful fragrance, not just in terms of sillage and lasting power but also in the general aura and feeling it carries. It's not one easily forgotten. I think it's perfect for fall and winter. Thanks Penhaligon's for another favorite to love!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="639694"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=639694#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent636958" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc636958" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bunnyhead"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/464801"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.464801.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bunnyhead" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Armani-Prive-Ambre-Orient-10885.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10885.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Armani Privé Ambre Orient"title="Armani Privé Ambre Orient"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma636958ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd636958" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/464801">Bunnyhead</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-10-08">10/08/15 05:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Here in the Southern Hemisphere we are just entering Spring. And I have found my signature for the season. This costs $270 AUD in the only retailer stocking it (Myer) but I picked up a bottle for a tad shy of $140 via strawberrynet (my first purchase) I was worried I may receive a fake based on some online reviews but I need not have worried. This is the real thing &amp; it is incredible! The staying power is great, especially since it's a EDT. I wear a sprizt to bed in the crook of one arm &amp; it's still there in the morning. I do the dishes &amp; it still lingers afterward.  Love. I may buy a second bottle to have in reserve!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="636958"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=636958#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent618955" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc618955" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jamiljames"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/934469"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.934469.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jamiljames" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/The-Library-Collection-Opus-VI-14661.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14661.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Library Collection Opus VI"title="The Library Collection Opus VI"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma618955ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd618955" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/934469">Jamiljames</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-08-07">08/07/15 16:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is an incredibly subtle warm fragrance. It took me a considerable time for me to appreciate this creation. It reminds me overall of fruit stored in a ship. The fig comes through as a prominent note. From sampling it I found there was nothing amazing. However it wears really well on the skin giving a rich warm base. Such a great mix of notes in this perfume. An enjoyable fragrance to wear for certain.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="618955"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=618955#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent604189" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc604189" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="racb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/927134"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.927134.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="racb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Black-Orchid-Eau-de-Toilette-31969.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31969.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Orchid Eau de Toilette"title="Black Orchid Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma604189ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd604189" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/927134">racb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-06-15">06/15/15 12:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Deep, complicated, herby, woody,  and fresh.<br />
<br />
I'm getting a blast of Middle East from this one. Rugged but refined. Manly but not heavy.<br />
<br />
James Bond would wear this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="604189"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=604189#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent572837" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc572837" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="randy.devost1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/164214"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.164214.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="randy.devost1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma572837ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd572837" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/164214">randy.devost1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-03-01">03/01/15 05:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Am I really the only one who is reminded of Swiss Army on this? Lothair Penhaligon is obviously a more refined version, but I think I might prefer the brute sexiness of Swiss Army.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="572837"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=572837#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent572816" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc572816" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Roge"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/431088"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.431088.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Roge" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma572816ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd572816" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/431088">Roge</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-03-01">03/01/15 03:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I haven't found a Penhaligon that I wanted to own but then again, it's not like I've been on a Penhaligon scavenger hunt either. But THIS can very much change all of that. Wow, wow and wow! The reviewers below got it right. The hype is legit. For all you people out there, I'm gonna make a bold prediction: If you smell this in the atmosphere you very well will make love to a stranger. Lothair is psychedelic hedonistic pleasure. Rich and full, this is a well-balanced aromatic. It has a good mix of herbaceousness, fresh citrus and vanilla, all intense and floral. Lavender wrapped in Fig Leaves are generously layered with woods. Good everyday bubbly perfume, non aggressive but all so serviceable. Another stellar fragrance to put on your want list.<br />
<br />
BLIND BUY WORTHY</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="572816"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=572816#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent571554" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc571554" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Abstrakt"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/763060"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.763060.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Abstrakt" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma571554ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd571554" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/763060">Abstrakt</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-02-25">02/25/15 01:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A fantastic meeting of Jaipur Homme (cardamom, vanilla, florals and woody notes) and Philosykos (fig tree, fig leaf).<br />
<br />
The result is a creamy, fig infused spiced vanilla fragrance.<br />
Delicious without being gourmand, green without being razor sharp. 10+ hours longevity, perfect sillage, great signature and a head turner. <br />
<br />
Best part, if you're a UK resident, Penhaligon's have 2 retail outlets (Bicester &amp; York) -  it's not uncommon to find it there at half it's hefty retail price.<br />
Well done Penhaligon's and thank you Mr Duchaufour.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="571554"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=571554#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent560104" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc560104" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="slapdash"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/158845"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="slapdash" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma560104ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd560104" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/158845">slapdash</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-01-19">01/19/15 10:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>As Bertrand Duchaufour's stock has risen in niche perfumery, so his has somewhat fallen with mine. Admittedly he set the bar extremely high with Jubilation XXV - and will be in credit for some time to come for that alone - but his more recent releases I've tried have been pleasant without capturing the imagination.<br />
<br />
Lothair marks a return to form.<br />
<br />
Save for a relatively safe, paint-by-numbers  drydown, you get a memorable blend of grapefruit, cardamom, geranium, juniper, black tea, lavender and oakmoss. I can distinctly smell each and every one of these notes (a rarity), and together the effect is crisp, cool and spicy. All of this is propped up by a deliciously sweet and creamy fig that had me grinning from ear to ear. <br />
<br />
A brief soapy phase follows (probably the cardamom) before Lothair reaches a woody/vanillic end that I  wish carried more of a flourish, but it's fine as it is. Indeed I'm inclined to be generous enough to go along with Penhaligon's inspiration of Tea Clipper ships and their varnished decks. It's probably just the power of suggestion, but I do pick up whiffs of something that is reminiscent of a top coat of polish.<br />
<br />
All in all, Lothair is an excellent fragrance that is easy to recommend.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="560104"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=560104#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent559860" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc559860" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ibrahimzen"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/797680"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.797680.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ibrahimzen" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Armani-Eau-de-Cedre-31401.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31401.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Armani Eau de Cèdre"title="Armani Eau de Cèdre"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma559860ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd559860" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/797680">ibrahimzen</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-01-18">01/18/15 12:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful! very fresh and something that I would wear after a shower, or at home in the morning.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="559860"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=559860#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent557987" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc557987" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="burgundyangel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/147450"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.147450.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="burgundyangel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Blackberry-Bay-15134.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15134.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Blackberry & Bay"title="Blackberry & Bay"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma557987ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd557987" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/147450">burgundyangel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-01-12">01/12/15 23:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A blind buy and one of those that I hit jackpot. I just read the reviews on Fragrantica, taking note of the notes, I "feel" that I should like it.<br />
<br />
And I did like it, like it very very much. Opening of fresh citrus (not heavy) got whiff of tea milky fig scent and stay close to skin. Very very similar to another of my fav. Acqua Di Parma Fico Amalfi. If you already own Fico Amalfi, you could skip it if tight on budget. <br />
<br />
Bottle packing is so lovely. Would love to add more Penhaligon's to my collection.<br />
<br />
Edit: 2 June 2015<br />
I LOVE this. Niche vibe to the max. Resinous of spices, very outstanding scent in a crowd.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="557987"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=557987#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent537467" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc537467" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Houdini4"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.607493.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Houdini4" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Indemodables/Vanille-Havane-Coeur-de-Oud-96892.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96892.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"title="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma537467ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd537467" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493">Houdini4</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-11-03">11/03/14 03:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I tried this yesterday and I have to say it's fantastic!<br />
Yet another enigmatic, smooth, complex yet effortlessly simple creation from Penhaligon's.<br />
 Lothair starts out with fresh top notes of juniper and fig, juicy and watery but then more herbal lavender strong, dry, woody notes, tea and oakmoss.<br />
 Slightly soapy spice of cardamom in there too it's typical Penhaligon's really, understated and elegant but in no way lightweight, Lothair to me comes off quite masculine.<br />
 Does suffer a little from the usual penhaligon's issue, Longevity! It's not great but totally acceptable because the fragrance is good...another winner from the house.<br />
<br />
Update: I'd just like to add that upon wearing some samples a couple of times now I'm glad I didn't buy a full bottle. Nothing wrong with it at all, it's all the things I expect from Pengaligons and largely what I said above, with the exception of quite a lot of cedar present throughout and I'm not sure it's as masculine as I first thought? I'm glad I opted for Levantium in the end, and I really don't get comparisons to Aberdeen lavender? Still alright though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="537467"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=537467#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent534527" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc534527" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Francop"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/30064"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.30064.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Francop" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Andy-Warhol-Success-is-a-Job-in-New-York-6526.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6526.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Andy Warhol Success is a Job in New York"title="Andy Warhol Success is a Job in New York"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma534527ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd534527" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/30064">Francop</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-10-23">10/23/14 10:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful &amp; complex take on lavender &amp; tonka bean with superb longevity.<br />
<br />
An absolute masterpiece of good perfumery.<br />
<br />
Well Done Penhaligon's!<br />
<br />
Thumbs up!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="534527"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=534527#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent518260" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc518260" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="DresdenDoll"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/33748"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.33748.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="DresdenDoll" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Indemodables/Oranger-Sirocco-95458.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.95458.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oranger Sirocco"title="Oranger Sirocco"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma518260ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd518260" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/33748">DresdenDoll</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-08-30">08/30/14 00:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Got a chance to try this new trio in Covent Garden and I definitely liked this one best.<br />
Lothair opens with a nice green citrus, but quickly settles with a relaxing fig note. <br />
It's a very comfy green scent for a while, neither sharp nor crisp, with very soft floral nuances. As it wears longer however a sweetness comes forward, which actually comes across more like tonka than vanilla, as it has a mildly powdery hint to it - perhaps working in combination with the oakmoss and geranium.<br />
It's fairly rich despite being green and chilled out, smelling quite round and well developed. It never smells typical though, this isn't a kind of green I've encountered before, with it's delicate balance of citrus and sweetness. If I had sniffed it blind I would have guessed it was from Diptyque, as it's very natural smelling and warm but transparent at the same time. A very nice offering indeed, I would recommend it for those who like English Fern by the same house or to those who like Infusion d'Iris, Philosykos or Chanel No 19 if they're looking for something slightly fuller and warmer but still green and understated.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="518260"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=518260#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                    </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent572816" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc572816" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Roge"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/431088"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.431088.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Roge" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma572816ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd572816" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/431088">Roge</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-03-01">03/01/15 03:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I haven't found a Penhaligon that I wanted to own but then again, it's not like I've been on a Penhaligon scavenger hunt either. But THIS can very much change all of that. Wow, wow and wow! The reviewers below got it right. The hype is legit. For all you people out there, I'm gonna make a bold prediction: If you smell this in the atmosphere you very well will make love to a stranger. Lothair is psychedelic hedonistic pleasure. Rich and full, this is a well-balanced aromatic. It has a good mix of herbaceousness, fresh citrus and vanilla, all intense and floral. Lavender wrapped in Fig Leaves are generously layered with woods. Good everyday bubbly perfume, non aggressive but all so serviceable. Another stellar fragrance to put on your want list.<br />
<br />
BLIND BUY WORTHY</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="572816"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=572816#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1025164" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1025164" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="j&aelig;"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1163986"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1163986.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="j&aelig;" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1025164ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1025164" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1163986">j&aelig;</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-01-27">01/27/19 21:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>How can a fragrance be so light and delicate yet so complex at the same time? Lothair manages to neutralize that contradiction. Unlike most of Penhaligon's other offerings, this one is both dynamic and long-lasting. Milky fig, bright and fresh juniper, smooth, reassuring tea all make for a subtly dazzling olfactory experience. Very unisex and inviting. Like taking a breath of fresh, fragrant air in the countryside after sitting in an air-conditioned rental car for six hours. A real delight.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1025164"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1025164#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent639694" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc639694" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ivyheel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/43035"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.43035.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ivyheel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-Cologne/Bergamote-Soleil-35155.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.35155.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bergamote Soleil"title="Bergamote Soleil"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma639694ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd639694" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/43035">ivyheel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-10-17">10/17/15 08:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligon's has quickly risen up the ranks as one of my favorite perfume houses, with Lothair being my most recent favorite. The advertisement for this fragrance promised to somehow take me back to the age of English tea clipper ships that delivered precious goods from around the world. To my delight, I seem to have stumbled upon a case of truth in advertisement.  The overall sentiment I get when wearing Lothair is that of being in a dry cargo hold surrounded by a mountain of crates containing tea, lavender, vanilla bean, dried fruits, and a mixture of other delightful commodities.<br />
<br />
On spraying, I get an incredibly strong black tea note (not brewed, but dried loose tea leaves), softened by a good dose of lavender and vanilla. Within minutes, the black tea is tamed and the vanilla gains steam along with a note that I am fairly sure is juniper. Fig is there (creamy!) but my nose seems to confuse it with some other scents...Overall it's herbaceous, creamy, and weird in a very good way.<br />
<br />
This is a powerful fragrance, not just in terms of sillage and lasting power but also in the general aura and feeling it carries. It's not one easily forgotten. I think it's perfect for fall and winter. Thanks Penhaligon's for another favorite to love!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="639694"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=639694#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent683251" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc683251" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ChubbyPillow93"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/616116"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.616116.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ChubbyPillow93" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma683251ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd683251" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/616116">ChubbyPillow93</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-03-03">03/03/16 02:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Indisputable and unparalleled masterpiece of Penhaligon's.<br />
I have never seen a perfume that can combine fig/lavender/vanilla/black tea without any disharmony.A huge thumb-up for Duchaufour!<br />
<br />
Among all the works of Bertrand Duchaufour, this is my favorite.And it has a beautiful name indeed:) Even at the first time I tested it I was sure that it is going to be marvelous.Although the lavender note has won quite a few votes, I would rather focus more on the fig &amp; black tea notes.Lothair belongs to the Trade Routes collection, and it was inspired by the famous Tea Clipper Ships.Therefore I believe that the black tea should be the theme of it.The tea leaves have the special astringent taste and the "unsmooth" but fresh smell, which made it very intriguing——for the fig/fig leaves smell are usually described as creamy and smooth.But!The combination turned out not to be a collision, but a surprisingly perfect harmony.<br />
<br />
The lavender here, despite the dominance, has already lost the soapy and harsh traits, I presume that it was vanilla's credit;Eventually, the whole thing has developed into a mixture of green/spice/creamy aroma, although it has the traditional aromatic structure(lavender/juniper/oakmoss), I myself consider this more as a modern artwork.<br />
<br />
-</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="683251"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=683251#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1215257" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1215257" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="katariina9"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/229642"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.229642.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="katariina9" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Comme-des-Garcons/Comme-des-Garcons-Series-7-Sweet-Nomad-Tea-4378.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4378.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Comme des Garcons Series 7 Sweet: Nomad Tea"title="Comme des Garcons Series 7 Sweet: Nomad Tea"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1215257ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1215257" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/229642">katariina9</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-23">08/23/20 16:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lothair is one of my favourites from Penhaligon's offerings, most of which I've sampled. It's the scent for cardamom and tea lovers. Crisp and clean, most of the freshness comes from juniper. The familiar G&amp;T note will tingle your nostrils at the opening, and stays until the dry down whilst giving this Trade Route scent a slightly windy and dynamic character. I'm born on an island covered with junipers so this smells like soothing yet energising seaside. I may as well stand on the rough beach eating a warm cardamom roll with a cup of black tea &amp; milk in the other hand.<br />
<br />
The whole scent experience here is expertly blended between soothing/calming and energising/refreshing. Lavender, juniper, bergamot, tea and green fig are all individually present, yet singing in perfect harmony, providing shelter yet urging you to move on. As the scent develops, cardamom is fully out in the open. There are no flowers or berries in the foreground, but they are invisibly keeping the balance, as is also vanilla that rounds things up when woods enter making the dry down amazingly cosy. Its a wonderful herbal aromatic concoction and a perfect scent for a dynamic duo to share. It never steps a foot more into feminine or masculine territory. Keeping it all on even keel.<br />
<br />
EDIT: I got it in its 100 ml presentation some 24 months ago. Considering I've a decent scent rotation, lots of samples and there has been home-office-anchored no-travel no-event situation for a year, I've managed to almost finish my Lothair. A small miracle. Or perhaps not. Its a strong love and will be a repeat purchase.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1215257"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1215257#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="27039" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1073300" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1073300" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cocofluff"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1141155"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1141155.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cocofluff" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/Bendelirious-4511.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4511.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bendelirious"title="Bendelirious"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1073300ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1073300" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1141155">cocofluff</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-06-26">06/26/19 02:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Excellent opening! Invigorating and refreshing. I smell juniper, bergamot and the grapefruit. It's fresh and sweet. The opening is herbal. And the drydown is creamy. I don't even mind the oakmoss because I can't detect it. It's perfect for daytime wear. Unisex as well. I really like it but not enough to buy a bottle. -</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1073300"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1073300#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1332834" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1332834" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SweetBriar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1018716"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1018716.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SweetBriar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Guidance-78656.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78656.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Guidance"title="Guidance"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1332834ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1332834" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1018716">SweetBriar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-26">04/26/21 18:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A bit too masculine for my enjoyment and a bit too boring and mainstream to want to smell this on my husband.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="27039"comment_id="1332834"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Lothair-27039.html?ccid=1332834#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent737182" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc737182" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mohsen95"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/995817"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.995817.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mohsen95" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma737182ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd737182" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);             <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Givenchy.html" class="en2inter">Givenchy</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">20.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">

        </span>
    </div>
            </div>
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">

        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">

<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFFe5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
